snippet: A former detective who called Internal Affairs about another officer accused the Police Department of violating his First Amendment rights.
abstract: Lawsuit against New York City by James E Griffin, former Brooklyn police detective who claimed his career was ruined after he was labeled a 'rat' by other detectives in his squad, is settled for $280,000; lawsuit offered look at retaliation that officers face for reporting allegations of misconduct.
lead_paragraph: A former detective who called Internal Affairs about another officer accused the Police Department of violating his First Amendment rights.

headline.main: New York City Settles Lawsuit by Detective Called a ‘Rat’
headline.print_headline: City Settles Lawsuit by Detective Called a ‘Rat’
